title: epi2me-labs/wf-trio
description: Nextflow workflow for trio sequencing analysis.

input.title: Input Options
input.description: Parameters for finding and handling input data for analysis.

proband_bam.description: Proband aligned BAM to use in the analysis.
proband_bam.help_text: This accepts one of two cases: (i) the path to a single BAM file; (ii) the path to a top-level directory containing BAM files for a single sample.

pat_bam.description: Paternal aligned BAM files to use in the analysis.
pat_bam.help_text: This accepts one of two cases: (i) the path to a single BAM file; (ii) the path to a top-level directory containing BAM files for a single sample.

mat_bam.description: Maternal aligned BAM files to use in the analysis.
mat_bam.help_text: This accepts one of two cases: (i) the path to a single BAM file; (ii) the path to a top-level directory containing BAM files for a single sample.

ref.title: Reference file
ref.description: Path to a reference FASTA file.
ref.help_text: Reference against which to compare reads for variant calling.

clair3_model_path.help_text: The workflow will attempt to map the basecalling model used to a suitable Clair3 model. You can override this by providing the path to a model with this option instead. Models can be obtained from [this page](https://cdn.oxfordnanoportal.com/software/analysis/models/clair3/index.html).

clair3_trio_model.help_text: The clair3 trio model to use for calling variants. See all available models here [this page](http://www.bio8.cs.hku.hk/clair3_trio/clair3_nova_models/).

analyse_unclassified.title: Analyse unclassified reads
analyse_unclassified.description: Analyse unclassified reads from input directory. By default the workflow will not process reads in the unclassified directory.
analyse_unclassified.help_text: If selected and if the input is a multiplex directory the workflow will also process the unclassified directory.

watch_path.description: Enable to continuously watch the input directory for new input files.
watch_path.help_text: This option enables the use of Nextflow’s directory watching feature to constantly monitor input directories for new files.

client_fields.description: A JSON file of key value pairs to display on the report.
client_fields.help_text: This is used to populate a table of additional information (for example, about upstream components of an assay) to the workflow report.

samples.title: Sample Options
samples.description: Parameters that relate to samples such as sample sheets and sample names.

proband_sample_name.description: A single sample name for non-multiplexed data. Permissible if passing a single .bam file or directory of .bam files.

pat_sample_name.description: A single sample name for non-multiplexed data. Permissible if passing a single .fastq(.gz) file or directory of .fastq(.gz) files.

mat_sample_name.description: A single sample name for non-multiplexed data. Permissible if passing a single .fastq(.gz) file or directory of .fastq(.gz) files.

family_id.description: A single family ID relating to the group of samples.

output.title: Output Options
output.description: Parameters for saving and naming workflow outputs.

out_dir.description: Directory for output of all workflow results.

advanced_options.title: Advanced Options
advanced_options.description: Advanced options for configuring processes inside the workflow.
advanced_options.help_text: These advanced options do not need to be changed for typical use, but allow fine tuning of workflows for users who want more control over the workflow.

phased.help_text: This option enables phasing of SV, SNP and modifications, depending on which sub-workflow has been chosen; see [README](README.md#9-phasing-variants) for more details.

bed.title: Target region BED file
bed.description: An optional BED file enumerating regions to process for variant calling.

minknow.title: Optional .bed file for enumerating regions to process for variant calling

basecaller_cfg.title: Basecaller configuration
basecaller_cfg.description: Name of the model to use for selecting a small variant calling model.
basecaller_cfg.help_text: Required for small variant calling. The basecaller configuration is used to automatically select the appropriate small variant calling model. The model list shows all models that are compatible for small variant calling with this workflow. You should select 'custom' to override the basecaller_cfg with clair3_model_path.

ctg_name.description: The name of the sequence to be processed.

include_all_ctgs.description: Call for variants on all sequences in the reference, otherwise small and structural variants will only be called on chr{1..22,X,Y,MT}.
include_all_ctgs.help_text: Enabling this option will call for variants on all contigs of the input reference sequence. Typically this option is not required as standard human reference sequences contain decoy and unplaced contigs that are usually omitted for the purpose of variant calling. This option might be useful for non-standard reference sequence databases.

ref_pct_full.description: Expected percentage of low quality 0/0 variants called in the pileup mode for full-alignment mode calling.

var_pct_full.description: Expected percentage of low quality 0/1 and 1/1 variants called in the pileup mode for full-alignment mode calling.

var_pct_phasing.description: Expected percentage of low quality 0/1 and 1/1 variants called in the pileup mode for phasing.

snp_min_af.description: Minimum SNP AF required for a candidate variant.

indel_min_af.description: Minimum Indel AF required for a candidate variant.

vcf_fn.description: Candidate sites VCF file input, variants will only be called at the sites in the VCF file if provided.

min_mq.description: Reads with mapping quality < min_mq are filtered (experimental).

min_qual.description: Variants with >=min_qual will be marked 'PASS', or 'LowQual' otherwise, optional.

min_contig_size.description: Contigs with contig size < min_contig_size are filtered (experimental).

min_cov.description: Minimum coverage required to call a variant (experimental).

GVCF.description: Enable to output a gVCF file in addition to the VCF outputs (experimental).
GVCF.help_text: By default the workflow outputs a VCF file containing only records where a variant has been detected. Enabling this option will additionally output a gVCF with records spanning all reference positions regardless of whether a variant was detected in the sample.

phase_trio.description: Output a phased VCF and haplotagged BAM.
phase_trio.help_text: By default the workflow will output a phased VCF and haplotagged BAM, set to False to skip.

glnexus_config.description: glnexus config yaml file, a default one is provided.

base_err.description: Estimated base error rate when enabling gvcf option, default: 0.05 (Reducing this will reduce the number of `./.` variants).

gq_bin_size.description: Default gq bin size for merge non-variant block when enabling gvcf option, default: 5.

disable_ping.description: Enable to prevent sending a workflow ping.
